answers.answer: Hi there. Cold feet and hands can occur due to raynaud’s syndrome, peripheral vascular disease, frostbite, cryo globulins, hypothyroidism, and allergies. Reynaud’s syndrome is a vasospastic disorder where the smallest blood vessels in toes start to constrict causing discoloration, brittle nails. These changes can begin when exposed to extreme cold temperature or emotionally upset. Peripheral vascular disease esp. in diabetes arteries constrict and prevent free flow of blood circulation. Cryoglobulinemia is a medical condition where blood contains large no. of cryoglobulin proteins which on reduction in temperature becomes insoluble. These insoluble proteins make the blood thick and obstruct its flow causing cold feet, stroke etc. You could massage the sole of the feet vigorously, wear warm socks, and go to the neurologist for medical conditions. Take care.
